items.content:
Product Manager, Acquiring Platform

Company: Stripe
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA

Build products to make customers successful.

The Payments Group at Stripe powers Stripe’s core payments-related products such as payment processing, fraud prevention, and Connect.

About the role:

At Stripe, Product Managers help build innovative payments products for our customers. Product development is an extremely collaborative effort between engineering, design, analytics and customer-facing teams. You’d be joining a team of experienced Product Managers who have a track record of successfully building large-scale business and consumer products that are collectively impacting millions of users around the world.

As the Product Manager on the Acquiring Platform team, you’ll work right at the center of Stripe, enabling and expanding the payment capabilities that are core to the Stripe experience.

  • Define and create the critical infrastructure that will power Stripe’s global payment network
  • Develop deep integrations with card networks and financial partners to create new and innovative capabilities
  • Drive the expansion of Stripe’s capabilities around the world
  • Launch a new products and tools that enable new payment experiences for our merchants

You may be a good fit if:

  • You’re a creative product thinker who loves challenging technical problems and collaborates well with engineering, analytics, marketing, and external partners
  • You have experience building or working on technical platforms that enable concurrent development of features by teams located around the world
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems and infrastructural challenges
  • You have experience working on deeply technical software products from kick-off to ship
  • You do whatever it takes to make your product and team successful whether that means writing a QA plan or hunting down the root cause of a user’s frustration
  • You can turn incomplete, conflicting, or ambiguous inputs into solid action plans
  • Beyond just shipping new products, you obsess about continuous product improvement and can optimize for shipping a portfolio of small, medium and large releases.

Requirements:

  • Experience working in the financial industry where you gained an understanding of financial infrastructure and how financial services differ across the world

What’s it like to work at Stripe?

Stripe is helping the internet fulfill its potential as a platform for economic progress by building software tools that accelerate global economic access and technological development. Stripe makes it easy to start, run and scale an internet business from anywhere in the world.

Stripe is, at its heart, an engineering company. To provide a missing pillar of core internet infrastructure, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills (and from a wide variety of backgrounds) who are ready to take on some of the most challenging problems in the industry – from reliably handling 100M API requests per day, to building adaptive machine learning as a result of years of data science and infrastructure work, and enabling entrepreneurs worldwide to start a global internet business.

We look at Stripe as a constant work in progress and the same is true of our people; for all of us, we believe the best is yet to come. We’re here to support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues.

We encourage all engineers to transition teams once every year and a half and also take on short-term projects with other teams across Stripe. This enables engineers to learn how different parts of Stripe work while also establishing stronger ties and cross-pollination between groups.

We contribute to existing open-source projects and the people working on them, and we release several tools as open-source.

We want to work in a company of warm, inclusive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. The kind of people who are committed to going out of their way to help other Stripes in the short-term and pushing them to improve over the long-term (by helping them to get better at what they do).

We’re a highly cross-functional organization and view that as part of the fun: we design our space to encourage as much collaboration as possible. We have long tables in the kitchen for a reason (to enable everyone to meet new people and learn from them). We also have a culture of transparency that we carry through to email communication, ensuring that Stripes all around the world have the information they need to make good local decisions.

In both our products and our people, we aim to reflect, represent and advocate for all of our users, globally. Our users transcend geography, culture and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a fairer, more economically interconnected world.

Guide to the onsite interview 

Apply for this position

https://stripe.com/jobs/positions/product-manager-acquiring-platform

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager


Giant Swarm



* Apply Using LinkedIn








We are looking for a Technical Product Marketing Manager

Your Job


* You are our first hire for our Product Marketing. We know that this is a key role in our products success and we want somebody who takes the lead here. We currently have three Product Owners and one Inbound Marketing Manager who closely works with our CEO. With all of them and the entire team you share and communicate your expertise and get things done.

* Our product is used by large enterprises and we have a lot of experience with why and how we do things and we intend on better communicating that, which will be one of your main responsibilities. Of course, you are not alone, but you’ll be taking the lead here.

* You are responsible for the content of our website, the creation of the product related part of sales materials, ebooks, pitch decks, product slides etc. You don’t have to do the organizational part, but enabling the Sales team and training them on our product, features and competitors should be something you are motivated by.

* Together with the Marketing and Content team, you ensure that our customers are informed about new features through product presentations, documentation, e-books and blog posts.






Requirements


* You have worked in Product Marketing before, technical writing will be a plus. Ideally, you have at least 3 years of work experience in a tech-driven environment (best case scenario, you have a background in enterprise software, cloud, open source and distributed systems). You don’t need to be a coder, but basic knowledge of Linux or a little bit of programming will help you understand what we do.

* You can deal with being empowered to make decisions and you like a high amount of self-organization in teams. We'd be happy if you have gained experience in cross-functional teams.

* You have a good grasp on the ecosystem we operate in and you understand the market, product, business, and any constraints involved.

* You like Research! You observe the trends in the ecosystem. You attend conferences and read relevant publications. You should also test-drive competitors solutions for comparison and input.

* You have excellent Communication skills in English and German. You are happy to transform complex technical stuff into simple and intuitive communications.




Why we think this Job is cool


* Impact, Impact, Impact! We are currently a fully remote organization with 25 people with 13 nationalities (located in 9 countries). Every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.

* You can dive deep into Product Development and Roadmap Creation. You are responsible together with our PO’s how and where new features will be promoted. You are leading here.

* Are you in love with a special topic? No problem. The way we’re organized into SIGs (Special Interest Groups) offer you the freedom to work on things you really love (UX, Security…)

* We serve some of Europe's leading organizations and are talking to many more. We play a key-role in our customers digital transformation. We have partnered up with AWS and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow. This diverse mix will help you to bring life to the broad field of Product Marketing for Giant Swarm.


See more jobs at Giant Swarm

items.content:
At Midrive, we’re reinventing driving and insurance for the digital generation. The old way of doing things is broken. 53% of learners fail their first test. Of those who pass, 1 in 5 crash in the first 6 months. That’s unacceptable.

Our technology helps learners find top-rated instructors and access pay-as-you-go insurance, so they can pass-first time and ultimately become safer drivers.

Since launch, over 300,000 young people in the UK have used our apps, data and tech to gain their independence. We are growing quickly and are now available in over 100 towns and cities in the UK, expanding to a new one each week.

Founded in 2013, Midrive has raised over £7.5m to date from a respected group of well-connected and supportive investors ‒ including Holiday Extras and Initial Capital. You may have heard about our recent crowdfunding round which was the 4th largest equity fund-raise target in Crowdcube's history.

We’ve recently been named #19 in the Startup 100, the annual ranking of the most game-changing and exciting new businesses launched in the last three years. We were also named ‘Digital Business of the Year’ by the Federation of Small Businesses in 2017.

Want to help us build the future of learner driving and insurance? Then join us!

Find out more about us at Midrive.com

REQUIREMENTS

We’re looking for someone with extensive hands-on experience of Google Adwords search campaign management, which would be their main focus in their current role. Data driven and methodical in their approach to performance marketing, they would have a proven ability to drive swift improvements in campaign performance.

This is an exciting opportunity to have an impact managing performance marketing for a fast growth startup! The purpose of the role is to drive efficiencies and growth in our performance marketing channels, including Adwords paid search and paid social campaigns.


Role objectives:

Build a best-in-class performance optimised paid search strategy.
Draw out actionable insights from performance marketing campaign data.
Analyse and report on campaign performance, refining CPA and ROI on all campaigns.
Plan, execute and report on all performance marketing channel tests and trials.
Develop initiatives to scale performance marketing channels in tandem with Midrive’s instructor supply growth across UK postcode areas.
Constantly seek out and trial relevant new channels.
Ensure all ad copy and creative is optimised to deliver the right message to target audiences, reflecting points of difference, addressing known customer interests and pain points in an engaging way.
Work closely with SEO, content and operations teams to share insights from paid performance.

Key skills and experience:

In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience managing Google Adwords. This is a required skill that you will be tested on, so only apply if you are confident that you meet this requirement.
Working knowledge of Facebook Ads and Google Analytics.
Good understanding of audience targeting and remarketing strategies.
Practical understanding of attribution modelling.
Experience managing large or complex paid performance channel budgets.

About you:

You have lived and breathed Adwords campaign management for at least 1-2 years, and are fully up-to-date with every targeting option and campaign management enhancement in the Adwords interface.
You may have gained your experience at a digital advertising agency, managing paid search campaigns on Google Adwords, or client-side in a B2C direct response focused business.
You find working with data stimulating, and can quickly draw out insights from performance marketing campaign data reports.
With a startup mentality, you are self motivated, a problem solver, ambitious, hard working, collaborative, and want to have an impact on business performance.
Ability to approach tasks as a team, and work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent attention to detail and a well organised, structured approach to work and the ability to keep projects on track.
You speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

BENEFITS

At Midrive, we work hard, so that's why we make sure that we have best facilities to play harder! We have a host of perks: Free coffee and snacks, Wednesdays treats, Happy Hour Thursdays, team yoga sessions, and training/sharing sessions. We also have regular fun social events - recent adventures have included a glamping trip, escape rooms, comedy clubs, and silent discos.

Midrive is simply a great place to work. We have a fantastic team of talented people working on an interesting product they are passionate about, and a friendly, social atmosphere. We're also a dog friendly office! Add to that competitive salaries, pension plan, and other perks, it's clear why we're a top choice.

DIVERSITY

Diversity and inclusion are essential values at Midrive. We know we'll do our best and most impactful work when we feel we're represented and we belong. We're proud to actively recruit and hire talented people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
_*This role is based in Munich*_

*About us*

GoCardless is building a new global network for recurring bank-to-bank payments. We’re cutting out the intermediaries and linking together direct debit schemes from around the world to create a simple way of collecting payments directly from customers’ bank accounts.

We’ve already won noteworthy German customers, including Magicline and Brandnooz, and have partnerships in place with both best-in-class global and German platforms, including Zuora, Sage and Billwerk. We currently process €3.5bn each year for over 30,000 organisations across the UK and Europe - and we’re growing over 100% year on year.

We’re backed by some of the world’s leading investors including Balderton Capital, Accel Partners, Notion Capital, Passion Capital and Y Combinator.

We’re looking for a talented and passionate German Marketing Manager to drive awareness and adoption of GoCardless in Germany. Focusing on our target segments you’ll be responsible for creating and executing on the marketing strategy generating interest and driving leads and revenue.



*Your role*

Working closely with the German General Manager and Sales team, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the German marketing strategy to deliver on the the agreed goals for Germany.
Owning the German marketing budget, you’ll be responsible for planning and implementing specific activities to drive awareness of GoCardless and generate a consistent stream of quality leads and customers to meet the revenue targets.

Supported by the wider Marketing team and a network of freelancers and/or agencies you’ll execute and optimise on campaigns to ensure we’re attracting and retaining the right type of businesses within our core target segments.



*What we're looking for*

We’re looking for a self-starter, excited by an opportunity to grow a rapidly expanding business in a relatively new market. We’d love to hear from you if you have an entrepreneurial spirit, enjoy working in small, autonomous cross-functional teams and are willing go the extra mile to get a job done.

*You should apply if:*

* You have a strong marketing background in B2B businesses in the German market
* You are experienced in working across multiple marketing channels, optimising the mix and the messaging for different audiences
* You are commercially astute and results driven, with strong quantitative analytical skills using tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau
* You have experience and are comfortable owning social media channels and monitoring engagement levels
* You are customer focused ensuring that your messaging and communications resonates with the target audience generating quality leads and long lasting relationships
* You are a self-starter who thrives on working independently with small cross functional teams and is comfortable with working remotely from the central business
* You have excellent communication and written skills and enjoy creating and editing great content
* You’re able to work across multiple teams and manage both agencies and freelancers
* German mother tongue and fluent in English mandatory, French or Spanish knowledge a plus

_Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, and we embrace diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply._

items.content:
MARKETING ASSOCIATE

Capdesk is looking for a Marketing Associate to join ASAP.  

We’re changing the world of finance across Europe and we want a smart, hard-working and creative marketing associate to help us. Our small but expanding UK team is based in London just off Shoreditch High Street.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a bright candidate to get into the world of FinTech and take on responsibility as one of the first junior hires on the team. You’ll see first-hand what it takes to build an industry leading FinTech startup as you’ll be working closely everyday with the CEO, Head of Sales and Head of Customer Success.

COMPANY

At Capdesk we are on a mission to change the way that start-ups and investors manage their shareholdings and investments. We launched in Denmark in 2015 and gained customers across the Nordics. In 2016 we moved over to the UK and in 2017 we really solidified our presence here.

We’re already helping some of the tech scene’s major players by removing the headaches associated with organising Shareholder Registers and Option Plans. Companies like Secret Escapes, Tab Media, Money Dashboard & Nutmeg. That’s why we’re Europe’s leading equity management platform. But this is just the start for us. 2019 promises to be a huge year at Capdesk and we want you to help continue our fantastic growth.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Actively manage and promote our blog, and articles.

- Researching and organizing facts and sources.

- Writing and proof reading a wide variety of topics for multiple platforms and overseeing the production of all marketing materials (website, blogs, articles, social updates, banners, case studies, guides, white papers, emails etc.)

- Working with in-house designers to produce materials of visual impact and within brand guidelines.

- Create content marketing campaigns to drive leads and subscribers

- Use SEO best practices to generate traffic to our site.

CANDIDATE

You should be excited about getting in on the ground floor of a fast-growing FinTech startup with a presence across Europe. We will teach you the technical aspects of how start-up financing works so we don’t expect a financial background or any formal training. However, this role is best suited to someone who has a natural passion for startups and wants to learn more.

We are looking for hires who can grow with the business so that means having a passion for learning and coming up with new ideas. We want people to own the process and continuously look for a better way to get things done.

BENEFITS

- Be part of a fast growing startup

- Work closely with the Co-founders everyday

- Free team lunch every day! We normally go to somewhere around Spitalfields Market or - Devonshire Square

- First junior hire on the team. Great opportunity for growth

- Work for company with expansion plans across Europe

APPLY

Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV to christian@capdesk.com

items.title: Chief Marketing Officer
items.content:
Volunteer Role Description

Job Title: Chief Marketing Officer
Team: Marketing
Location: Remote
Reporting to: CEO
Staff Management: Marketing Team (between 6-8 volunteers)
Job Type: Volunteer
Time Commitment: 8 hours minimum per week (plus any more time you are able to offer)

We Make Change gives you the power to change the world.

Our platform enables anyone, anywhere to use their skills to make the change they want to see.

We connect purpose-driven individuals with high-impact NGOs to develop projects supporting the causes they care about.

This is an unpaid volunteer opportunity, but whatever skill you have and whatever cause you care about, you can change the world. By becoming a Changemaker you can help to make it happen!

Main Purpose of the Job
To inform, inspire and empower people to change the world through engaging, innovative and distinctive marketing.

Overview of the Role & Team
This position will involve overseeing all of the organisation’s marketing activities and initiatices. This will involve coordinating the activity of the team as well as contributing to the various areas of marketing, including social media and PR, where necessary. Working in collaboration with people from across the organisation and reporting to the CEO, this role is key to increasing the awareness of the organisation and its activities.

Responsibilities
Providing effective leadership to the Marketing Team.
Coordinating and organising the activity of the Marketing Team.
Support the Social Media Manager in executing a social media strategy that will inspire people to take action to support the causes they care about.
Work with the Bloggers to create fun and engaging blog content, ensuring content is posted regularly.
Engage with NGOs from around the world to develop content for social media, blogs and PR.
Work with the PR Officer to plan, develop and implement PR strategies and campaigns.
Developing good working relationships with the media.
Collaborate with other members of the We Make Change Team to manage reputation, identify key players and coordinate actions.

Requirements
Professional experience working in social media, marketing or PR is required.
Excellent writing, editing (photo/video/text), and communication skills.
Knowledge of online marketing and good understanding of major marketing channels.
Positive attitude and detail oriented with good multitasking and organisational ability.
Fluency in written and spoken English

Location
The role will be performed remotely, so applications are welcomed from across the world.

As the role is as a volunteer, it is unpaid, but it offers a great opportunity to gain experience, while helping to change the world!

Whatever cause you care about, whatever skill you have, if you want to change the world, then become a Changemaker by applying today.

items.content:
We’re a specialist, award-winning digital agency famed for designing, building, maintaining, optimising and promoting e-commerce websites with our unique psychology-based approach.

*Goal:*

To support agency growth through winning new client business by:

* Ensuring all inbound prospects & opportunities are responded to, qualified and filtered promptly.
* Liaising with the relevant department heads & digital strategist to develop compelling proposal & pitch documentation.
* Keeping accurate records on all opportunities and communications, and managing follow up communications
* Assisting the Sales Director in onboarding new business and transitioning new business to the Client Services team for delivery.

*Outcomes:*

* Qualify all new opportunities
* Develop new client proposals
* Support with closing new business opportunities

*Job Description:*

This is a new, full-time, London-based position for a Sales Support Administrator.

A fantastic opportunity for someone who is energetic, organised and hungry to grow new business and be part of a successful and growing digital marketing agency. You will be the backbone of our sales team, reporting directly to our Sales Director and supporting him with our ongoing new business growth.

You will be responsible for managing all new opportunities in our sales funnel end-to-end; As such you will be required to promptly qualify all inbound prospects, proactively follow up all suitable opportunities, managing the delivery of proposals and pitch documentation (alongside the Sales Director) and ensuring there is a smooth transition to our delivery teams for all new business won.

*What the job will entail:*

* Qualifying all prospects and opportunities that come through the agency
* Working closely our digital strategists and heads of department to collate strategies and create compelling proposals & pitches
* Managing all opportunities and keeping records within the agencies CRM
* Managing the after-sales process and ensuring new clients are on-boarded smoothly and client services teams are fully briefed.
* Keeping abreast of the latest digital marketing trends and strategies and communicating these to potential clients with a view to converting them into paid clients

*Required Competencies:*

* Highly Personable and great with people
* Ability to communicate a specialist subject clearly to potential clients
* An understanding or strong desire to learn about digital marketing, including PPC, SEO & CRO.
* Smart, presentable and professional.
* Great with prioritisation. You must be able to balance the ‘reactive’ side of the job with the longer-term goals.
* Attention to detail, particularly with reporting results
* Dynamic and results driven with the ability to work well under pressure
* Ability to work independently and towards your own goals
* Be hungry for personal development and success
* Have the willingness to ask for help when needed
* Have complete ownership and accountability of your own work

*Experience*

* You must be able to demonstrate that you are an excellent communicator and good with people.
* High level of Literacy & Numeracy skills
* Digital experience is preferable but not a must but must be quick and eager to learn.

*The team you will be joining:*

We are looking for a driven, hungry individual to join our awesome and already growing team.

On top of this, we want to make sure that each candidate is a good fit within our team and our company culture. We only want to work with candidates that reflect our core beliefs:
* Strive for excellence (not mediocrity)
* There is a way around everything. It’s just a matter of finding it.
* Choose Growth, Not Protection
* Empower and inspire each other.
* Contribute your ideas, don’t simply take orders.
* Stay lean, go fast and break things.
* Never stop learning, Be Curious and Adapt to win.

*What you will get:*

* To work for a fast growing, awesome company that you love going in to work for.
* The opportunity to do what you love with the chance of a fast-track career progression.
* A personalised training program and mentoring to be completely awesome at your role.
* Work with fun, creative and driven employees that love what they do.
* A very competitive salary.
* The chance to build and grow your own account management department.
* Access to our bank of psychology, e-commerce and marketing and sales knowledge.
* Access to our library of books, articles and training courses.
* Unlimited fruit and coffee (and on Friday, beer, wine, bubbles, or anything your heart desires).
* Be at the forefront of the digital marketing revolution (we are way ahead of most agencies – what you’ll learn with us, you’ll use forever!)

Education

items.title: SEO Sales Consultant
items.content:
About Us

Design Your Way LTD is a digital marketing and lead generation start-up company.
We have a small number of websites generating leads, valued between £15,000 -£200,000. We are now looking to extend the SEO branch of our company and looking to hire a full-time sales consultant to outreach for SEO clients.

We are looking for

Self-motivated, experienced, confident, and innovative SEO Sales Consultants who can both prospect and sell local lead generation and SEO services to businesses around the UK.

Although this role is commission only, we are offering 20% of all future profits that you have generated, while the client is still active, even if you leave us. Sign up 10 clients to earn a passive income of £24,000 per year!

Job Description

This is a remote working, sales only role and you do not need to do any of the SEO work yourself.

All you really need to do is follow this process:

1. Approach business owners
2. They sign up,
3. You get paid.
4. Rinse, and repeat.

Simple!

Responsibilities

• Identify, and secure new SEO Clients.
• Maintain and grow relationships between us and the business owners.
• Negotiate a contract between us and clients that is co-beneficial.
• Able to report and mediate between us and the client.
• Able to work 2 - 3 days a week.
• Have a clear and concise strategy to secure clients within a suitable period.

Skills & Knowledge

• Experience outreaching for and acquiring SEO clients.
• Confident approaching businesses.
• Self-motivated with a passion for SEO sales.
• Disciplined with a targeted sales approach.
• Desire to exceed expectations.
• Confident to adapt sales approach via calls, e-mail, and face to face if necessary.

Benefits

• 20% ongoing profits that you have generated paid to you on a monthly basis (even if you leave us!)
• You can fit this into any lifestyle and enjoy a passive income even while you are on holiday!
• Remote working.
• Flexible working hours.
• Opportunity to stay on during future expansion on an improved deal based on performance.

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
*Company:*
Think GPS and how it revolutionised many industries and organisations from how we order taxi or food or meet friends to how companies manage their fleet and logistics (or military) and how telcos use this data for targeting. The same revolution will happen indoors where we already spend majority of our times. Think smarter airports, malls, hospitals or even cruise ships.

Pointr is a pinoeer technology company building world's indoor location infrastructure. Key facts:
* Live projects in 14 countries
* 35+ head count
* HQ in London, sales office in Dubai, engineering office in Istanbul, and remote team members in Greece, US, Spain, Belarus and Hungary
* Many international awards
* Many international tender wins (even against the likes of Apple, Google, Siemens, DHL and many others)
* Many prestigious clients including Harrods, IKEA, Sainsbury's, Dubai International Airport, London Gatwick Airport and more

*Role:*
* You will be heading up anything marketing at Pointr, ranging from sales collateral, promotional videos to international event participation to PR and social media
* You will work closely with Business Development team for working on collateral and PR
* You will define marketing strategy and report to CEO
* Mainly London based but some travel (especially Europe and North America) will be expected for events
* Full-time role
* You will have libery to hire specialists (eg. video production company, bloggers) as and when needed

*Requirements:*
* Strong marketing background and experience
* Passion for technology and startup environment
* Enthusiasm for b2b / enteprise sales
* Good communication skills, strong command of English
* Medium to Strong experience with design (eg. producing a poster for an event or a graphic for social media)
* Great team player and do'er attitude

*Nice to haves:*
* Additional spoken languages (Spanish, French, Swedish)
* Experience with b2b sales
* Jack of all trades

We work hard (don't expect a slow paced 9-5) and you will take on a challenging role. Equally, it will be rewarding and you will learn and grow.

items.title: Marketing Manager
items.content:
Exciting new startup in the process of raising equity funding is looking to bring on a Marketing Manager.

The company is bringing a popular existing game into the 21st century by integrating cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. The role will be part time initially, with the opportunity to be brought on full time. Remote working accepted for the initial stage.

Ideally the candidate will be as follows:
- Has knowledge/interest in the cryptocurrency/blockchain space
- Has the will to play a key role in the success of the company
- Is a self-starter and can work without major supervision
- Experienced in managing different digital marketing campaigns (SEO, Content Marketing, PPC, etc)
- Experienced in coming up with innovative ideas for campaigns
- Experienced in creating visuals for said marketing campaigns (or at least the ideas for said visuals)

On offer is:
- The chance to be part of an exciting company
- The opportunity to work alongside smart, like minded people
- The opportunity to share ideas as a key member of the team
- The opportunity to eventually build your own team

Compensation is negotiable.

Please apply to this role mentioning previous experience, knowledge of crypto, why you think you would be the best person for the role and one thing of your choice which may convince us you are the right person.

items.title: Product Manager Trainee
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, Do it with Passion, or not at all.

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We’ve created a software-as-a-service that allows you to build and launch native mobile apps with just a few clicks.

We are looking for an inspiring, engaged and motivated new member of our Product/IT team.

You want to become a great product manager with the vision to change the future of learning.

Your mission will be to define and further develop ground-breaking software-as-a-services and mobile apps for our partners and customers that bring the Passion.io learning experience to the next level and to millions of people anytime, anywhere.

*What you'll be working on*
* Supporting the Product Owner
# You will be assigned to the product owner who will be your mentor during the entire program
# You will drive focus product projects to leverage and bond with your mentor
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
* Benchmarking Products incl. UX/UI
# You work on product development while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the product while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing our products, have a clear idea about the future product, and how it will transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects/features through the lifecycle from conception to launch
# Setting up and conducting UX tests and improve the platform
* Kanban / Scrum
# You are going to develop and prioritize product roadmaps
# Thus you are taking care of the product backlogs and prioritize them accordingly
# As part of this role you organize and set goals for sprints
# You are in charge of the technical demands of the product and make sure to motivate all stakeholders towards a common goal
* Design Thinking / Customer Obsession
# Be the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centred perspective
# You keep functionality, usability, performance and quality of the product in mind
# You are in contact with customers and users to learn from them and optimize their problems
* Prep project for your new role
# In this module, you will identify and implement a complex project that prepares you for your new role

*What you'll bring to the team*
# You have first experiences with kanban and/or scrum and successfully operated sprints before
# You worked in start-ups in the product department
# You have got experience of working at the intersection of business and technology and have a basic understanding of IT infrastructure
# You are hands on and look for pragmatic solutions
# You are good at keeping the bigger picture in mind and can thus organize yourself and your team
# You have strong cross-functional communication skills

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

Currently, the founder & CEO is the product owner. Your mission will be to take over this responsibility. You will define and further develop ground-breaking software-as-a-services and mobile apps for our partners and customers that bring the Passion.io learning experience to the next level and to millions of people anytime, anywhere.

*What you'll be working on*

# Most of all, look forward to rolling up sleeves each day and inspiring others with energy and passion for our products
# Be an active user and thought leader, not just an observer

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Entrepreneurial mindset, ability to understand customers needs
# Previous CEO/founder experience is a plus
# Minimum 5 years of experience in Product Development in an online business or fast-growing internet startups
# Experience of leading cross-cultural diverse teams where different localization strategies and communications are required
# Strong awareness of current mobile & web technologies, trends, products, tools, and design standards
# Data informed decisions: strong ability to understand & synthesize data
# Ability and internal drive towards solving problems
# Outstanding team leadership and communication/interpersonal skills
# Fluent in English

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.content:
Company

Upingo facilitates one-to-one in-person networking opportunities for the London Startup community. The Founders have significant ambition for growth.

We are looking for an Undergraduate or recent Graduate who wants to join an early stage Startup with full responsibility for Marketing.

Who are we looking for?

We are seeking an enthusiastic, self-motivated team member to drive the growth of the platform. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to be awarded equity in the business (in the near term) and become a key part of the Founding Team.

Location

The candidate will work remotely, though it makes most sense to be based in London. Hours will be flexible, though the capacity to engage with the Founders within certain windows (to be agreed upon) will be important.

Role

-Architecting and executing the social media strategy for Upingo.

-Responsibility for planning and financial control of all digital marketing.

-Copywriting for customer email marketing, newsletters and social media.

-Review and analysis pay-per-click social media accounts.

-Architecting and executing digital and email marketing campaigns.

-Analysis of marketing effectiveness and carrying out A/B testing.

-General sector research and analysis.

Requirements

-Undergraduate or recent Graduate in a Marketing discipline (candidates with a different academic background should be able to demonstrate successful marketing projects or relevant independent study).

-Experience/strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategies and best practices. 

-Excellent communicator (fluent in English).

-Self-motivated and proactive.

Why work for Upingo?

This is a phenomenal opportunity for an Undergraduate or recent Graduate to put their learnings into practice in the real world. For the right candidate, an equity award (in the near term) is very possible and moreover, the opportunity to join an ambitious Startup, making a positive impact, at the earliest of stages.

Job Type: Part Time.

Salary: Unpaid, but good potential for equity award for the right candidate.

items.title: Epic Analytics Developer I - Cheyenne Regional Medical Center - Cheyenne, WY
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Epic Analytics Developer I

Company: Cheyenne Regional Medical Center
Location: Cheyenne, WY 82001
ROLE SUMMARY

The Epic Analytics Developer I is proficient in the organization’s clinical and/or revenue workflows and is organization’s expert report writing. This individual acts as the liaison between operations and data; is responsible for the quality and accuracy of reports produced by the Epic Reporting team.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Design business intelligence reporting platform utilizing Epic data.

2. Provides report specific advice for design and solutions for reporting needs.

3. Advises customers and recommends reporting options using reporting expertise.

4. Escalates potential system and work effort risks; contributes to status updates.

5. Sets priorities for reporting requests and works with the requesting customers to understand the prioritization.

6. Uses the full portfolio of Epic and non-Epic reporting tools available.

7. Responsible for maintaining existing reports and analyzes/evaluates requirements for changes, system upgrades, etc. while preserving data integrity and quality control of reports.

8. Reviews upgrade documentation related to Clarity features and released Crystal reporting content and determines how to implement the changes.

9. Assists end-users in the interpretation and integration of reports.

10. Construct testing scripts to validate system parameters and functionality performs as specified with application teams for accuracy of reports.

11. Assists with onboarding new employees as needed.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified and employees may be required to perform other duties as assigned.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, EXPECTATIONS, AND ABILITIES

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work both independently and in teams
  • Ability to independently prioritize work assignments, meet deadlines and manage multiple projects and/or priorities
  • Proficient with SQL and relational database concepts, including primary keys, foreign keys, and joins
  • Ability to use report writing tools such as Business Objects
  • Proficient in developing a test plan and executing test scenarios for system readiness
  • Able to cross train to other areas if necessary
  • Skilled with data warehouses, data stores, and data marts
  • Comfortable facilitating communication amongst technical and non-technical project staff and stakeholders
  • Expert in translating user requirements into functional and design specifications
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment, problem solve and develop solutions
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, email, intranet, internet, and other IT systems.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Two years of experience in Information Technologies
  • One year of healthcare experience
  • Epic certification in at least one application and/or able to achieve Epic certification within 90 days of last class
  • Able to maintain Continue Epic Education requirements for certification
  • Able to travel for training or work with remote clients
  • Available outside of normal business hours
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in relevant area
  • Two years of experience in design, architecting, implementation and support of relational databases including use of SQL query techniques to access relational databases
  • One year of project based experience

items.title: Product Owner for Electricity Data Intelligence Startup
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=36, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
*About Voltaware*

Voltaware is a dynamic London-based start-up at the forefront of energy monitoring and electricity usage itemisation.

We’re developing machine learning algorithms and building UX optimised interfaces to deliver real data insights to business and domestic users.


*The Team*

You’ll be joining an international team of entrepreneurs, engineers and designers with a history of successful application development and an enthusiasm for innovation and developing cutting edge applications.

Product Owner for Electricity Data Intelligence Startup


*We are looking for* an experienced and enthusiastic product owner to ensure the success of our product line-up. You will be in charge of understanding user and client needs and translate them into business cases.
We also expect you to liaise with our Data Science team and understand what is possible and how to embed knowledge into our products. Data Science is a rapidly evolving and exciting field with huge potential. We want you to be a part of it and help us realise its full potential with break-through products never seen before!
Join us for a journey instead of a job!


*Responsibilities*

* Maximise the value of the product, contributing to efficient deliveries and satisfied customers
* Liaise with clients to understand their use cases and translate them into product strategy
* Ongoing management of functional specifications and change requests throughout the entire life-cycle of development projects
* Produce high quality use cases and requirement documents
* Work hand in hand with the development team, following the agile sprints as product owner
* Manage development backlog according to the product strategy
* Maintain and communicate the product road map to the management team
* Interact regularly with the sales and distribution teams to gather feedback from the field
* Regularly participate in client meetings and field implementations


*Requirements*

* Enthusiastic about technology and innovation
* Strong oral and written communication skills are essential!
* Ability to work in a distributed and highly multicultural team


*Preferred Experience*

*Have worked on a project involving machine learning and data science
*Previous product owner roles preferable
*Experience working with start-ups
*Have worked with international and remote teams
*French or Italian languages is a plus



In addition to your CV, please submit the answer to the following question:

What excites you about working in a start-up?

items.title: Online Marketing Manager
items.content:
Online Marketing Manager

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: Marketing Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for an experienced, data-savvy Performance Marketing Manager to join our growing team. You will develop the end-to-end acquisition strategy to drive quality leads through thoughtful, optimized campaigns across all paid media channels. The Performance Marketing Manager should be ready for a steep learning curve, lots of responsibility and lots of fun in a fast-growing startup.

Daily Operations:

Develop strategic acquisition marketing plans to drive growth, improve conversion, and maximize results;
Set up and manage paid advertisement campaigns for user acquisition through the main channels (Facebook, AdWords, Twitter, LinkedIn and others);
Manage tracking, reporting, and analysis to draw insights and continually optimize marketing activities;
Optimize campaigns to drive down customer acquisition costs and increase the volume of new customers acquired;
Contribute to landing page optimization in order to improve conversion;
Knowledge of Google Analytics and other tracking tools;
Take responsibility for your designated channels, markets & budgets;
Coordinate with internal stakeholders, including creative/copy, technology, product and other departments to ensure consistency of marketing messages and user experience across all digital and offline channels;
Stay current on digital marketing trends and best practices, focusing on how changes can help improve and optimize campaigns towards our target KPIs.

Previous experience/skills:

1-3 years proven success managing SEM & SEA channels as well as retargeting;
Working experience in crypto field is a plus;
Experience with other data and analysis languages/tools a plus (Google Data Studio, Tableau, Power Bi etc.);
Knowledge and prior usage of tools like Adroll, Outbrain, Taboola;
You like to work with data and have strong skills tracking and attribution;
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills;
A rigorous, data-driven, and highly analytical mindset;
Ability to analyze a range of key performance metrics and synthesize findings into clear trends and actionable recommendations;
Outstanding and proven communication and organizational skills with a focus on teamwork, project management and follow-up;
Prior experience working in a startup environment is a plus;
Full professional fluency in English.

What we offer:

Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pensions, blockchain and crypto industries;
A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
Flexible working hours;
You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.
Please, note that to pass the first stage you must complete a test task, which could take anything from 30 minutes to five hours to complete. If you don’t want to do the test task, then this vacancy probably isn’t for you.
About us:
Akropolis is an international fintech startup founded in 2017 which is solving a US$36 trillion pension shortfall problem by building the next generation pensions and savings infrastructure on the blockchain.
Akropolis works with industry-leading advisors and specialists and is also backed by many global, prominent investors. Akropolis has teamed up and formed strategic partnerships with the world’s top blockchain organisations and institutions. We are creating decentralised pensions on the blockchain and a safer financial future for humanity, built by and for the people.
